clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Health and Its Relation to Development and Well-being of Schoolchildren Before and After Restorative Treatments
clinical_study.official_title: Oral Health and Its Relation to Growth, Development and Well-being of Schoolchildren Before and After Restorative Treatments

brief_summary.textblock: The present study aims evaluate the oral health conditions of schoolchildren and its relation to growth, development and well-being. Also, it seeks to evaluate different restorative interventions performed at school premises in primary teeth and its impact on the quality of life.

detailed_description.textblock:
Schoolchildren, aged 6-8 years old, from the six public schools of a deprived suburban area of Brasília, Brazil will be recruited. In the stage 1 of the study, an epidemiological survey of the oral health status and an anthropometric evaluation of the children will be performed. Potential patient for study's stage 2 will be recruited. Quality of life surveys, patterns of oral hygiene and socio-demographic data will be collected.
Children with restorative treatment needs will be included in the study's stage 2. In this second stage, primary molars with deep dentin lesions will be treated according to two techniques for selective excavation of carious dentin: subjective criteria or using an objective criteria (polymer burs). For both groups restorations will be performed using a high-viscosity glass-ionomer. In shallow and medium depth dentin lesions, carious dentin will be excavated using hand instruments only (ART approach) and restored using two materials: a high-viscosity glass-ionomer or a combination of a self-etch adhesive and a bulk fill composite.
All children will be followed up (study's stage 3) to assess efficacy of the restorative interventions and impact of the restorative treatment on children's quality of life and development.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Success of the restorative treatment, not requiring any re-intervention (as endo or extraction). Success will be measured at different time frames.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: ART criteria for restoration survival will be used to assess survival of restoration (see Hilgert, 2014)

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life (and change in quality of life)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 12months after intervention (change in quality of life)
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life - Brazilian version of the Early Childhood Oral Health Impact Scale (B-ECOHIS) Questionnaires

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Initial and follow-up treatment costs to allow cost-effectiveness analysis
